beer.beer_description:
Bravo Zulu is a classic

German pilsner produced with Nova lager yeast, the clean fermentation profile gives an effortlessly drinkable, crisp and refreshing lager. Tettnang and Hallertau Blanc hops in the whirlpool lend a slightly. fruity and floral hop aroma with subtle notes of white grape and spice.

Bravo Zulu is a classic

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 140 distinct venues!

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 345 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.
Light and crisp, a Pilsner is all you need to make your day great. Though, perhaps another one would make it even better. That’s 25 different Pilsners. Try 5 more for Level 6!

user.bio: The green, sticky spawn of the stars, an unholy mix of an octopus, a dragon and a human caricature...

items.checkin_comment: A very smooth full-bodied lager. Such a step up in the lager world.

user.bio: Family loving beer mat flipping cycling fan, book designer, twice Town Mayor, pub enthusiast and one time bollard artist

user.bio:
Burning up in flames,

Reduced to nothing but ash,

Drifting on the wind
A novice cicerone but an expert in inebriation

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 110 check-ins with a photo.

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 155 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 32!

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 20 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 5!

items.badge_description: Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 315 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 64.

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 265 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 54!
